It's very dangerous to be blind, as some

Authorities successfully rescued a victim whose
hand was stuck in a
dough mixer to find relatives of two twins abandoned on the side of the

Binh Chanh district, Ho Chi Minh City, successfully
rescued a victim whose
hand was stuck in a
dough mixer. The victim was identified as a worker from
Ben Tre who was working at a vermicelli making facility
on Lien street, hamlet 26, Dinh Loc commune.  A
Binh Chanh district, around 4:00 p.m. on
December 25, a group of workers discovered a case whose
hand was stuck in a dough mixer. People
around turned off the power to try to rescue them
but were unsuccessful. They received the news that the
authorities had mobilized the pliers cutters.  hydraulic system
to save people. After being rescued, the
victim was given first aid on the spot by medical staff
and then transferred to the Binh
Chanh District Police Hospital to continue investigating and
clarifying this occupational accident during
Christmas in Dong Nai.  People discovered
two abandoned twin babies on the side of the road
on December 25. The People's Committee of Cay
Gao commune, Bang Bang district, announced to find the
twins' relatives
around 7:00 p.m. on December 24,
people discovered.  There was a cardboard box and a
plastic case left on the side of the road in Tan Lap hamlet,
Cay Gao commune, Trang Bom district. Upon inspection, it was
discovered that inside were two twins,
a boy and a girl, about a week old.
In addition, the plastic case had  many
children's items and a letter stating that because she was a
single mother in difficult circumstances, she could
not raise her children thanks to her family
raising two children. The incident was then
reported to the local authorities and the
commune police.  Cay Gao then took the two children for a
health check and verified the
case. After 7 days of notification, if no one
came to claim it, the Commune People's Committee would
carry out procedures according to regulations.

Every year on Christmas day, many
people come to soak in the cold water village
in Orancy, Berlin,
Germany, with an air temperature of over 10
degrees Celsius and a water temperature of 5 degrees, about 50
people.  members of the Berlin Seal Club went
down to take a dip in Oran Ki Lake. Some
participants said that the lake water this year
is cold but not ice like in
previous years but still not very cold so
a little ice would be even better.
This traditional Christmas activity has been held since Hai gan
BC lin was founded in 1980.
This club usually meets at Oran ki lake on
Sundays from mid-September to the
end of April to enjoy  The cold
underwater Berlin Seal currently has 157
members, of which the youngest is 12 years old
and the oldest is nearly 90 years
old. After coming up from the lake, many people
put on warm clothes and sang
songs together.  Christmas songs
are considered a

of theirs. From this concept, a
restaurant in the Italian capital Rome was

also serves Special Guests.
This fiuto restaurant is located in Ponte Milvio in the

a bed and a watering area in the middle.  Divided

dogs are so busy interacting with each other that they
forget to eat. Non-cars have a
separate menu for dogs and are judged based
on their weight because the restaurant owner
believes that dogs  The bigger they are, the more they eat.
Nowadays, dogs are considered
family members and are cared for like
children. When they leave the house, the owner will
take the dog with them wherever they go, whether it's a
walk to a restaurant or the beach.

2013 The traditional bull swing season has begun
in Tanas Datata district, Western province  sumara
Indonesia Although the name of this model Baku chwi
means bull racing, the cows
here do not compete together and the event does
not declare which pair of cows is the Winner.
Instead, the audience will evaluate the
performance of the bulls.  The cow is mainly about
speed and especially the ability to run in a
straight line. From there, the best cows
in the race are bought. Farmers stand
on wooden trees tied to two cows and
control them to run cross-country.  The
cows run straight and I have to bite their tails
to make them run faster. It takes 3
to 6 months of training to get them ready for the game. It's
very entertaining for those from
outside the district. It's an
annual event.  Held for
four consecutive weeks in four communes of
Tan Dat district, the race has been a tradition in
this region for centuries. It started
as an activity of farmers after the
rice harvest season, they gathered together to race
cows for  fun before the sowing season
the races usually take place from noon
until dark Baku ja is held in
parallel with the local cultural festival
called Alex Baku
